chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Juan Flortino Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Defense is requesting a motion to adjourn for reasons stated on the record. State does not object.  Court granted defense motion to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Juan Flortino Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial.  Attorney Copeland is requesting an adjourned final pretrial to have time to speak with his client.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 2:30 pm for final pretrial by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Final pre-trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court denied defense request to modify bail. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 9-12-22 at 8:30 am and jury trial on 10-24-22 at 8:30 am
Received and Filed:  State's Motion for Joinder.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a bail/bond hearing, final pretrial, and jury trial dates. Court set dates as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are still negotiating.  Defense is requesting status conference.  Case is adjourned to 7-18-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel has an offer and discovery and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel is in trial in another court and is unable to appear for this case.  Court will allow case to be heard off the record.  Parties notified of new court date by email.  Case scheduled for status conference at 5/23/2022 at 8:30 am by zoom.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
03:37 PM Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Johnson. Court took judicial notice of 22CF558 & 22FA774. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRF (1/9/1980); JTF (11/03/1998)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with GPS supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a initial appearance.  This case should be heard on an in-person court date along with defendant's other cases.  Case is adjourned to 4-19-22 at 1:30 pm for an Inital Appearance in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
